text:
School board member apologizes for threatening to have person deported
MEMPHIS, Tenn. (WMC) - Shelby County Board of Education member Towanna Murphy issued an apology Wednesday after messaging a person and threatening to “have them deported.”
A screenshot of Murphy’s message was sent to Action News 5. In the message, Murphy responds to the person’s criticism by saying, “Baby be quiet before I have you deported.”
She also insulted the person’s looks and said “Your mama a b---.”
School board chair Joyce Dorse Coleman issued a statement following the comments, saying the board does not condone them.
Coleman did not say Murphy faces any punishment at this time.
“As Board Chair, I, along with my colleagues, will continue to review any further necessary steps in addressing Board Member Murphy’s activity pursuant to Board Policy.”
In Murphy’s statement, she acknowledged her response, “did not represent the professionalism and respect that I know should be a standard in my service as an MSCS Board Member.”
